s gonorrhea syphilis scarlet fever food poisoning Lyme disease plague tetanus typhoid fever and most pneumonias are due to bacteria In many cases the bacteria produce powerful toxins that interfere with normal body functions and bring about disease The botulism food poisoning and tetanus toxins are examples In other cases bacteria grow aggressively in the tissues for example tuberculosis and typhoid fever destroying them and thereby causing disease Bbakitiriya awatali kubuusabuusa kasirikitu aka

s and Enzitoyo matter both derived from the verb okuzitoya to give weight to something to make something heavy or obuzito weight Entabaganya Society is derived from the verb okutabaganya to socialize to mediateor okutabagana to mix with others to relate with others xi Omuwords Omuis used to refer to a human being Omu also denotes a number or a value omuwendo It is used to derive the mathematics concepts Omugerageranyoratio that is omuwendo ogugerageranya Omukunuukirizo estimation is a derivation

cond Luganda math word for polynomial ekiyingo is ekibalo kyennyingo the math of termsjoints You can note that I have formed Luganda math words basing on etymologies with which Luganda speakers are familiar Ennyingo Luganda term for nomial or term is a sub division of a sugar cane that brings out the concept of polynomial ekiyingo or naamayingo Take a sugar cane with three joints ennyingo satu to be ekibalo kyennyingo ekiyingo or naamayingo This sugarcane with three joints can be nnyongo emu mon

e Obunyukufu literacy comes from the Luganda word ennyukuta or ennukuta letter We can also talk of Obunyukufu or Obunukufu literacy Ebyobunyukufu or Ebyobunukufu literature Unlike English in Luganda we make a distinction of oral and written literature by separating the concepts Oral literature is ekigambulolo stated by word of mouth but written literature is ebinyukuto or ebinukuto as written down A Police statement and a Bank statementare however even after they are put down in writing refered

 Ensikirizo attraction is itself derived from the ordinary Luganda verb okusikiriza to attract to entice as that which takes place between members of the opposite sex One other concept separated from word is that of the atmosphere which in English refers to both the atmospheres of planets with life as well as the atmospheres of the planets which dont hold the conditions for life To separate the concepts from the word I have called the atmospheres of the planets which have conditions for life lik

ting Forecutting is removing the beginning of a word as in akongezalinya from nakongezalinnya adjective or akongezakikolwa averb from nakongezakikolwa adverb d Complex cutting Complex clipping is removing multiple parts from multiple words as ekkamuso from endaga ya kkala za Musoke rainbow omugerageranyo ekigerageranyo amasoboza or omulengera This is related to blending Acronyms are a subtype of blending or complex cutting Enziringana yObubalanguzo the Order of Operations IALI NGO has been autho

empuyi sides which form the phrase nemba ezenkanya enjuyi numbers that make two sides equal Using the technique of blending we get the concept of nakyenkanyampuyi which is the Luganda word for equations or equation The other technical required terms under this topic are Nakyekubira Inequality or inequalities Musikiza substitution Okusikiza to substitute a variable enkuumakifo with a number Okusikiza namba to substitute a variable with a number Akenkanyanjuyi the equals symbol = Nakyenkanya njuyi

Buganda were centered on hills that were away from the public Such hills where the wise men and women spent time thinking and doing research in various fields of life included i Research centershills in Bulemeezi Bbowa hill Ssempa hill Walusi hill Kigozi hill and Busowa hill all in Bulemezi Luwero Nakaseke districts ii Research Centers hiils in Ssingo Other hills of seclusion for the great thinkers of ancient Buganda used by the Ganda geniuses are Kateeranduulu Mubende Magala Kagaba Buloda Bwanj

you can see that an acronym is a set of abbreviations formed by the initials of two or more words These components may be I Individual letters Like the letters making up a word such as the Luganda math word NESI for English GCF or EESE the Luganda math word for English LCM NESI in full is Nambuluzo Eyawamu Esingayo Greatest Common Factor and EESE in full is Enkubise Eyawamu Esembayo Lowest Common Multiple II Parts of words This makes acronyms closely related to blends in some instances A good ex

intelligent man or omuntu omugezi wise man e Omulengera the human mind This concept is formed by blending of the words omwoyo ogukulengeza the spirit that illuminates to getomulengerathe soul of foresight the spirit that foresees Omulengera the mind is a faculty of the brain that brings about critical thinking analysis knwowing understanding and discovery among others f Nnyoloni neuron This is a loanword from the english word neurons Nnyoloni neurons are simply the building blocks of the brain T

 elementary particles The concept akatinniinya is formed by blending the words in the phrase akatoffaalo akatini ennyo viii Obutunniinya Alpha and beta particles The concept obutunniinya is formed by blending the words in the phrase obutundutundu obutini ennyo Obutunniinya are actually Obutoffaaliany kindo of particles Dont confuse obutoffaaliparticles with the biological obutaffaalicells ix ObusannyalazoElectrons Sessomo Academic Disciplines in Luganda Academic disciplines in Luganda are indica

a gya kyebiriga square roots Omulandira gwa kyebiriga is also referred to as omulandira ogwokubiri ogwennamba the second root of a number Ennamba za kyebiriga emirandira gyazo egya kyebiriga giba Kubanga singa okubisaamu buli emu emirundi ebiri ofuna enamba eza kyebiriga The shape above is called kyebiriga square Kyebiriga is calculated by multiplying a number two times For example if the number is n when you multiply n x n you get ekitondeko product n which is called kyebiriga yennamba n the sq

rs to a value as distinct from number Ennambiso numeral is a symbol but a number is the name of a symbol The building blocks of numbers are the digitsfigures called digito in Luganda Values and numbers are almost synonyms but the value depends on the place of a particular digit in a number This means that the digits have different values depending in the places where they are found in a number In Luganda we can talk of omuwendo gwekifo to mean place value in a number Omugereeso is the Luganda wo

rd for mathematical theory So when we want to say number theory in Luganda we say omugereeso gwennamba or omugereeso gwa namba In fact every topic in the mathematical field of study can be referred to as omugereeso For example we can talk of omugereeso gwessomampimo to mean the theory of geometry or omugereeso gwemigereko to refer to set theory Omugereeso gwa namba number theory gutandika na kuyiga namba obutaffaali obuzimba omugereeso gwa namba ne sessomo lyekibalangulo lyonna okutwalira awamu

tuukirivu kitegeeza akabonero komulandira kaba kaviirawo ddala ngomaze okuwandiika omulandira Ekyokulabirako √ esonjolwa nga √ Emirandira gyEnnamba explained in English The Luganda word omulandira is the direct translation of the English word root which has the same biological and mathematical meanings Every tree has a root which supports it absorbs water and nutrients from the soil In number theory omugereeso gwennamba every composite number ennamba ennambulukufu has a root omulandira Emirandir

derive the mathematics concepts Omugerageranyo ratio that is omuwendo ogugerageranya Note that Ekigerageranyo rate has been derived from the Luganda verb okugerageranya to compare And as you know the English concepts ratio and rate both have to do with mathematical comparisonsEkigerageranyo is from the phrase ekibalo ekigerageranya ku buli namunigina Omukunuukirizo estimation is a derivation from the Luganda verb okukunuukiriza to aim at to reach out forThe new mathematical concept of okuzingako

fo Commutative Property Okugatta nokukubisaamu mibalanguzo egirina ebisonjozo ebyempanyisabifo Mu kugatta a + b = b + a Kino kitegeeza nti mu kugatta empanyidabifo tekyusa alizaatiansa Ate era mu kukubisaamu a b = b a Kino kiraga nti ne mu kukubisaamu empanyisabifo tekyusa alizaati Ekinnyonnyozo ebyenkwanaganya Associative property Ate era okugatta nokukubisaamu birina ebinnyonnyozo ebyenkwanaganya associative properties Okugatta a + b + c = a + b + c Kino kitegeeza nti mukugatta okukwanaganya n

 subtype of blending Did you know that the word acronym itself is an abbreviation An acronym in full is A Common Representation of Names you must shorten It is said that the English word NEWS is an acronym from initials or abbreviations of the words North abbreviated N East abbreviated EWest abbreviated W and South abbreviated S The implication is that information broadcast by media houses should come from all the directions Other Important English acronyms which we cannot avoid using in Scienti

 Enkunu Cylinder Gakuweebwa Charles Muwanga Enkunu = Enkinu Cylinder Enkinu or enkunu are formed by blending from the Luganda phrase enkula eyekinua shape which looks like a local mortar This is its local etymological definition EnsoggoCone Gakuweebwa Charles Muwanga Gakuweebwa Charles Muwanga EnsoggoCone Ensoggo= Enkula eyolusoggo Bwogattika ebigambo byoluganda bibiri enkula eyOlusoggofunnel shaped ofuna omulamwa EnsoggoCone nga bwolaba olwendo EnsoggoCone is formed by blending from the Luganda

 emmere okukula obulungi Emmere gye tulya ebaamu ebiriisanutrients emibiri gyaffe gye byetaaga okuzzaawo obutaffaali obukaddiye Ebiramu bwe bifa ne bivundira mu ttaka ebiriisa ebibibaamu bimerengukira mu ttaka ate emirandira gyebimera me When living things die and rot in the ground the nutrients in them end up in the soil and get dissolved in it As a result plants roots are able to absorb nutrients such as salts potassium minerals starch phosphates and nitric acids from soils too Amasoboza kyeki

e Speaker of Buganda Lukiiko Raphael Kasule also called Raphael Kiyonga Kasule was the son of Matthew Kisuule also known as Matayo Kisuule the royal gunsmith to Bassekabaka Mutesa I and Mwanga II Raphael Kasule was among the team of prominent Baganda elders who traveled to London to negotiate the return of Bugandas King Sir Edward Mutesa II from exile Okukomola Abakyala Okukomola abakyala nsonga emaze ebbanga ngeyogerwako naddala mu mawanga ga Afrika Ekitongole kyEbyobulamu mu nsi yonnaWHO kinny

hich parts of two or more words but not the words on their eternity combine to create a new word whose meaning is often a combination of the original words Word formation by okugattika therefore results into change of spelling Do you know that most technical terms in science and mathematics are formed by blending okugattaganya and compounding okugattika Yes this is true but still many others are adopted and adapted using other techniques Concepts formed by blending okugattaganya compounding okug

translatesa wise person and kalimagezi is translatedintelligent man Amagezi translates wisdombut obwakalimagezitranslates the practice of intelligence intelligence Generally the various concepts associaated with the word amagezi wisdom are a Obwakalimagezi intelligence Obwakalimagezi is a compound word whose root is amagezi wisdom This root is combined with a prefix obwapractice of to produce the concept of obwakalimageziintelligence b Omuntukalimagezi intelligent man Omuntukalimagezi is a hypha

t of false pretense coning c Obunyunyunsi exploitation act of exploitation d Obunyukufu skill or act of using letters literacy e Obunukufu same as above literacy The concept of obunyukufu or obunukufu literacy has been derived from the Luganda word ennyukuta or ennukuta Luganda for letter More words have been derived from the new concept of obunyukufuobunukufu These include a Omunyukufu omuntu omunukufu literate person b Omunyukufu owa kibogwe semiliterate person vi Obu means state of It is also

e new word is not connected to the meanings of the parts For example Endagakifo is a marriage of the words endaga showing + kifo where I am but the combination of the two words Endagakifo is used to mean the Geographic Positioning System GPS a reference to an entire machination of the gadget Generally compound words may be written as one word or as two words that are open or joined with a hyphen For example i Nounnoun compound For example a Obuziba + bbomu →Bbomu yobuziba atomic bomb b Obuziizi

m Kiva mu kinnamakulu obuyivu ekiwanvu Akawango kano kavvuunulwa undo okusumulula okubikkula Ekyokulabirako  Okulambulula to factor to explain in detail  Okulimbulula to undo a lie to tell the truth  Okusumulula to untie  Okugambulula to say or state the facts nop hearsay ekigambululo statement Manya okugamba to tell to say anything naye okugambulula to tell only the facts no hearsay ekyawamu Akawango kano kalaga kufaanagana Ekyokulabirako  enkubise eyawamu common multiple  Endowooza eyawa

o in Luganda Any intellectual language must have the concept for statement which is ekigambululo from the Luganda verb okugamba to say or to state You can now talk of ekigambululo kya police police statement ekigambululo kyebyensimbi financial statement among others as you will learn from this book Those concepts are necessary to make a mother tongue an intellectual language but the beginning of turning a cultural language into a language of science must be to build the three basic concepts of f

is a blendword from the Luganda pharse embeera ewaliriza iii Okuva motion iv Akaziba atom v Obuziizinucleus vi Obutonniinya subatomic particles vii Obutinniinya elementary particles The concept akatinniinya is formed by blending the words in the phrase akatoffaalo akatini ennyo viii Obutunniinya Alpha and beta particles The concept obutunniinya is formed by blending the words in the phrase obutundutundu obutini ennyo Obutunniinya are actually Obutoffaaliany kindo of particles Dont confuse obutof

the familys lineage within the clan that it belongs to The clan has a hierarchical structure with the clan leader at the top owakasolya followed by successive subdivisions called the ssiga mutuba lunyiriri and finally at the bottom the individual family unit enju Every Muganda was required to know where he falls within each of these subdivisions and anyone who could not relate his ancestry fully was suspect of not being a true Muganda After the coronation of Kabaka Mutebi II in a survey of the c

gero reactors are derivations from the borrowed loan word atomu or akatoffaalikazimbakintu atom What takes place at atomic level among atoms to cause a chemical change is what is called okutomeggana to react chemically vii The concept of enkyukakyuka ezebuziba chemical change is a compound word from the Luganda word ebuzibaorobuziba the innermost part the farthest part the core When compounded with the word enkyukakyuka change we get a new concept in chemistry enkyukakyuka ezebuziba chemical cha

 Bwotya okutwalibwa mu kkomera oba wekengedde nti oyinza okukifunamu obuzibu obwenjawulo  Bwotya okugobwa ku mulimu oba olowooza nti oyinza okukifunamu obuzibu Kino kikuyamba okweteekateka nga otuukana nomutindo oba nga onoonya ekirala ekyokukola nga obadde ogobeddwa  Bwotya okwogera ku kintu kiba kitegeeza nti oyinza okukifunamu obuzibu  Bwotya ensolo kiba kitegeeza nti wekengedde nti eyinza okukutusaako obuzibu obuvune  Bwotya obwavu kiba kitegeeza nti otegedde nti obwavu mpologoma ekutta 
le In mathematics emikwataganyo functions are a subset of emikwanaganyo relations xi The concepts of omugereko set and emigereko gyekibalangulo mathematical sets are derivations from the Luganda word okugereka to arrange in groups xii The mathematical concept ebiyingo polynomials or Naamayingo polynomials is a derivation from the Luganda word ennyingo joint term Other concepts derived from the word ennyingo include Nnyingemumonomial Nnyingobbiribinomial Nnyingosatu trinomial Nnyingo ezifanaganal

nda IALI NGO has been authorized b y terminologist Charles Muwanga to post this article from his Luganda scientific terminology research on Luganda wikipedia for free public consumption Enfundiwazo Abbreviations The concept of enfundiwazo abbreviations is from the Luganda word okufunza ebigambo to abbreviate meaning using initials of a word Abbreviations are formed by the initial letters of a word or phrase Enfundiwazo are mainly used in written language not spoken language In the chemistry of L

tant past In the customs of Buganda lineage is passed down along matrilineal lines The clan essentially forms a large extended family and all members of a given clan regard each other as brothers and sisters regardless of how far removed from one another in terms of actual blood ties The Baganda took great care to trace their ancestry through this clan structure A formal introduction of a muganda includes his own names the names of his father and paternal grandfather as well as a description of

ngeThe opposite is enkyukakyuka ezo kungulu physical change viii The concept of omugendo movement in a straight line a ray is derived from the Luganda verb okugenda to move to go Other concepts created from this concept are Omugendo gwekitangaala light ray Omugendo gwamasannyalaze current Omugendo gwamasoboza a ray or movement of Energy Ekigendo vector The synonym of omugendo movement is okuva Motion Okuva refers to any kind of motion whether it is a continous motion in a straight line or not ev

e the planet earth nampewo because it is a combination of gases which make up the air required for life empewo eyobulamu In fact nampewo is a blend word from the phrase nakazaala wempewo eyobulamu Muwanga has called the atmospheres of planets that lack conditions for life namikka meaning mere gases mikka bukka that dont have the ingredients that make life sustaining air empewo Lastly but not least to separate concepts from word Muwanga has formed the twin concepts of okutonda the act of creation

erivations from the Luganda verb okutabagana to socialize or okutabanganya to mediate ii Okutondeka to produce the act of creation by man and entondeka yebikole production are derivations from okutonda the act of creation by God or okutondeka to create the act of creation by man In Luganda we can now say that ensibuko yobugagga bwamawanga eri mu ntondeka ya bikole the source of the wealth of nations is production iii The mathematical concepts of okulambulula namba to analyse to factor numbers an

omial nnyingobbiri binomial or nnyingosatu trinomial In mathematics ab + a abc are an example of a mathematical expression with three joints which you can now call three terms It is an example of a trinomial nnyingosatu because it has three terms You can also have ab as one joint term or nnyingo emu called monomial and aabc which is made up of two joints terms which you can call nnyingobbiri binomial because it is made up of two joints terms iv Nnyingo ezikwataganaLike terms We can now also talk

 concepts formation by combining words or parts of words include a Combining bits or fragments of words by Okugattika Blending b Combining by Okugatta Compounding Luganda scientific concepts formed by Blending Okugattika ebigambo Okugattika ebigambo Okugattika blending may be referred to as complex cutting which is removing multiple parts from multiple words and joining the remaining parts into a single concept Okugattaganya or okugattika is Luganda for blending a concepts formation process in w

Centers named after the great thinkers who used them as their places of research and work In the end we are merging culture with modern science something that catapulted the Japanese Chinese and other formerly very cultural socities into advanced industrial societies We should for instance be able to talk of i Nakayima Nagadya Kitinda or Nabuzaana Medical Research Centers ii Bbowa institute of motorcycle and bicycle technology research iii Kungu Leadership institute iv Mpaga or Mabira forestry r

following mathematical concepts are derived Namba ennambulukufu composite numbers Namba ezerambulula composite numbers Namba ezitali nambulukufu prime number Namba eziterambulula prime numbers iv The mathematical concept of okugendaggana to be parallelParallelism is derived from blending the two Luganda words okugendana to match to be equal in strength or magnitude to correspond with plus okugaanagana but never to meet Through semantic extension the meaning of the word okugendana is extended to

lations xi The concepts of omugereko set and emigereko gyekibalangulo mathematical sets are derivations from the Luganda word okugereka to arrange or to group a collection of things xii The mathematical concept ebiyingo polynomials or Naamayingo polynomials is a derivation from the Luganda word ennyingo joint term Other concepts derived from the word ennyingo include Nnyingemu monomial Nnyingobbiri binomial Nnyingosatu trinomial Nnyingo ezikwatagana like terms Nnyingo ezitakwatagana unlike terms

babutonde Entababutonde Ecology Etymologically the Luganda concept entabagutonde connotes interaction interactions between animate and inanimate as well as between animate to animate components of nature on Earth Entababutondeecologykiraga enkolagana oba akakwate akaliwo wakati wobutonde obwebiramu nebutonde obwebitali biramu ebiramu mwe biwangaalira Obuwangaaliro bwebiramu Entababutonde ssomo erisoma ensengekera zentababutondeEcological system Ensengekera zentababutonde ecosystems zinnyonnyola

lso has the same function as Eby prefix Examples of academic Luganda disciplines formed using essomaprefic include Essomampimo or Ebyempimo Geometry Study of Geometry Essomansi Geography Esomanjazi Geology Essomabutonde Science of Nature Physics Essomabuzimbe Physics Essomampuyisatu Trigonometry Essomabiramu Biology Essomabutonzi Divinity Essomabinyunyunsi Parasitology Essomaddagala Medicine Essomabuyambi Nursing When forming academic disciplines in Luganda Muwanga has used the Luganda prefix es

ka yebikole production are derivations from okutonda the act of creation by God or okutondeka to create the act of creation by man In Luganda we can now say that ensibuko yobugagga bwamawanga eri mu ntondeka ya bikole the source of the wealth of nations is production iii The mathematical concepts of okulambulula namba to analyse to factor numbers and ennambuluzo factors of a number are derivations from the Luganda word okulambulula to explain in detail From the concept of okulambulula namba the

 adopt in order to accommodate a new but indirectly or closely related meaning For example Luganda Scientific Concepts formed by Derivation from affixes IALI NGO has been authorized by terminologist Charles Muwanga to post this article from his Luganda scientific terminology research work on Luganda Wikipedia for free public consumption Okukozesa Obuwango The addition and subtraction of prefixes and suffixes is an important technique for the formation of new concepts in a vernacular particularly

ence to the trio Calculations mathematics or science behind the operation or movement of something So ekitambuzo is the science calculation or math behind the movement of the parts of a body system or structure The system could be any structure as a machine We can hence talk of  Ekitambuzo kyomubiri body mechanics  Ekitambuzo kyemotoka the mechanics of a vehicle  Ekitambuzo kyennyonyi the mechanics of a plane  Ekitambuzo kyekinyonyi the mechanics of a bird This is what we mean when we talk o

mpalirizo eyabulira oba eyewaggula ku makakti in Luganda the resulting effect is the science that keeps the planets in their It is a result of opposing forces empalirizo ezisikira ku mpuyi bbiri eza kikontana Essikirizo for gravity as ensikirizo is for magnetic attraction The concept of essikirizo is derived from the concept of ensikirizo attraction because essikirizo means ensikirizo ennene strong attraction When we blende the words ensikirizo ennene we get the blend word essikirizo for gravity

e but obwebulungirivu is Luganda for perimeter Ekisengeko is the Luganda math word for matrix It is arranged as follows in form of emigaramirorows and emisimbalaalacolumns It is formed by blending the words in the phrase ekibalo kyemisengeko the math of patterns The verb okusengeka to arrange is obvious in the math word ekisengeko From okusengeka we derive the concept of omusengeko Luganda for pattern The above two are both Luganda concepts for Polynomials The English etymology of Polynomials is

amaanyi Yulaniyaamu Uranium Gakuweebwa Charles Muwanga Akaziba ka Yulaniyaamu era kayitibwa Atomu ya Yulaniyamu Uranium atom mu Luganda Akaziba ka yulaniyaamu nantalabikalabika si ku nsi kwokka naye ne mu bwengula ne ku ngulungo endala Kino kiva ku kuba nti okufaanana nekikulembero oba zaabu yulaniyaamu etondekebwawo munda mwa semufu eziba zibwatuka era kubanga erina obukontanyo ne nampa nnyingi munda mwayo teyetondekawo mangu Akaziba ka yulaniyaamu ke kasingayo obuzito kwbwo obusangibwa mu buto

fu same as above literacy The concept of obunyukufu or obunukufu literacy has been derived from the Luganda word ennyukuta or ennukuta Luganda for letter More words have been derived from the new concept of obunyukufuobunukufu These include a Omunyukufu omuntu omunukufu literate person b Omunyukufu owa kibogwe semiliterate person vi Obu means state of It is also used to form nouns from verbs eg Obukambivu state of being vicious viscosity Obukwatufu state of being vicious viscosity Obukwafu state

obutali buggumivuunstable nuclei Obuziizi obutali buggumivuUnstable nuclei buba bubumbulukufu era busobozesa ekifulumyalubugumuradioactivity Endagabuzimbe enzigumivuStable elements Endagabuzimbe enzigumivuStable elements ziba nobuziba obulina obuziizi obuggumivuatoms with stable nuclei ekitegeeza nti zino tezifulumya lubugumu they dont emit radiation Endagabuzimbe ezitali nzigumivuunstable elements Endagabuzimbe ezitali nzigumivu unstable elements ziba mumbulukufu are radio active kuba zifulumya

gth or magnitude to correspond with plus okugaanagana but never to meet Through semantic extension the meaning of the word okugendana is extended to refer to the mathematical concept of being proportional to but when combined with the word okugaanagana we get the concept okugendaggana to be parallel Other mathematical concepts derived from this are Amaweto agagendagana corresponding angles Okugendanakifuulannenge inverse proportionality Layini ezigendaggana parallel lines Enkoloboze ezigendaggan

public consumption The article bellow tries to clear the misconception outside Africa and among many contemporary black Africans that black Africa did not have a community of philosophers and great thinkers In Buganda our departed great thinkers are simply dubbed Balubaalegiver spirits Many Baganda still think that when a genius or a thinker dies his spirit remains capable of doing the great things of wisdom he or she performed during his or her life time We know his writings are going to make m

ment is continous motion and for animals like humans it is locomotion or the act of moving called okutambula From okutambula we drive the Luganda concept ekitambuzo which is Luganda for machanics Dont confuse the concepts ekitambulizo and ekitambuz When you analyse the word ekitambuzo it is formed by two Luganda words ekibalo ekitambuza ebitundu byensengekera The math and science that moves parts of a system Unlike in ekibalangulo mathematics in physics essomabutonde therefore ekibalo is a refer

 chemistry In Luganda okuwanga to affix refers to the process of derivation that involves adding what is referred to as akawango a derivational affix Akawango is attached to the root of a word to create a new concept Obuwango affixes include obuwango obusookeso prefixes and obuwango obuvannyuma suffixes Prefixes Prefix Meaning Obu the act of Obwe Characterized by or inclined to Essoma Study of En Appearance of or away of doing something Omu Number value or a human being Eki Drawing of or mathema

 from the Luganda verb okukunuukiriza to aim at to reach out forThe new mathematical concept of okuzingako to round off is a derivation from the Luganda word okuzinga to fold Omukunuukirizo is from the phrase omuwendo omukunuukirize Omutonnyeze The mathematical concept of omutonnyeze decimal number is a derivation from the Luganda noun akatonnyeze point When you add the prefix omu you get omutonnyeze decimal value decimal number Omutonnyeze is from the phrase omuwendo ogwakatonnyewze xii Ekiword

In the exponent nm Mu mufunza nm n is the entobo or ekikolo also called enfunzo base and m is akafunza the power The entire concept or topic is known as mufunzaexponentiation whose meaning is a result of semantic extension of the ordinary meaning of the word mufunzashort form tightening If you are given x x x x x x x This can be indicated in short form as In Luganda this may be called okufunza Luganda scientific concepts formed by combining methods IALI NGO has been authorised by terminologist C

ementary particles The concept akatinniinya is formed by blending the words in the phrase akatoffaalo akatini ennyo viii Obutunniinya Alpha and beta particles The concept obutunniinya is formed by blending the words in the phrase obutundutundu obutini ennyo Obutunniinya are actually Obutoffaaliany kindo of particles Dont confuse obutoffaaliparticles with the biological obutaffaalicells ix ObusannyalazoElectrons Essomabiragala Pharmacology Essoamkalondawebiramu owekiseera Phenology Essomamalobooz

le to name the three major branches of biology that is essomabulamu bwensolo animal biology essomabulamu bwebimera plant biology and essomabulamu obusirikitu micro biology In most African societies it was not known that there are microscopic organisms In Luganda microorganisms are referred to as obulamu obusirikitu which require a microscope which is referred to as enzimbulukusa endaga ezimbulukusa obusirikitu Obulamu obusirikitu microbs include bbakitiiriya bacteria vayiraasi virus polotozowa p

nated compound of two words omuntuman human being and kalimagezii intelligent person You can also just say kalimagezi to mean intelligent man c Komasapiyensa Homo sapiens It is a loanword borrowed from the english homo sapiens wise manKomasapiyensa can also be translated Omuntu kalimagezi d Ensolo kalimagezi intelligent animal This is a concept of two seperated compound words ensolo animal and kalimagezi intelligent being a genius The synonyms are omuntu kalimagezi intelligent man or kalimagezi

biriga namba kuba kugamba nti namba n x n == n eya kyebiriga n squared The resulting shape enkula is called kyebiriga Why Kyebiriga etymologically comes from the Luganda numeral bbiri two It means multiplying a number by itself two times If the number is multiplied by itself two times the resulting product ekitondeko is called kyebiriga Watch this x = is therefore namba ya kyebiriga square number number which is in Luganda The mathematical shape enkula eyekibalo formed is kyesatuzaCube Enkinu or

wa nebiruubiriro Ekiruubiriro kijjibwa mu kiruubirirwa yadde nga kirina ekigendererwa kye kimu nekiruubirirwa yadde nga kyo ekiruubiriro kyesonjovu nnyo okusinga ekiruubirirwa Ka tugambe nti entabaganyo yo enekoddeyo ekizibu ekigyolekedde nga enkozesa yobutonde eyekyeyonoonerero Ekigonjoolo kyekizibu ekyo kibeera okuziiyiza enkozesa yobutonde eyekyeyonoonero Oyinza okulaga nti ekiruubirirwa kino si kirambulukufu bulungi nga obuuza buttonde ki obukozesebwa ekyeyonoonero Baba bayinza okukuddamu nt

ahedron feesimwendabwenyimwenda a solid figure with nine faces These shapes are vernacularised by compounding not blending because the compounded words are joined directly without changing the spellings There are three common bwenyibungi polyhedral These are also Bwenyibungi Polyhedrons  FeesimukaagaBwenyimukaaga Tyetrahedron  Ekigulumiro ekya mawetasatu Triangular prism  Kyesatuza Cube  Ekigulumiro ekya bwenyimusanvu Pentagonal prism  Ekigulumiro ekya bwenyimunaana hexagonal prism  Ekigul

 named after the Roman gods and goddesses I have likewise opted to attempt to name the planets in Luganda after some of the great thinkers of ancient Buganda given below Position from the sun Planet Etymology Kiwanuka Mercury Ancient researcher on the cause of the lightening Ddungu Venus Ancient hunter and animal researcher from Mabira Kyaggwe Ensi Earth This was borrowed from the English word Earth Mukasa Mars Ancient researcher on the movement of winds on lake Victoria Nalubaale Kisuule Saturn

ta particles The concept obutunniinya is formed by blending the words in the phrase obutundutundu obutini ennyo Obutunniinya are actually Obutoffaaliany kindo of particles Dont confuse obutoffaaliparticles with the biological obutaffaalicells ix ObusannyalazoElectrons Essomabiragala Pharmacology Essoamkalondawebiramu owekiseera Phenology Essomamaloboozi Phonology Essomabitundubya biramu Physiology Essomabimera Phytologybatony Essomabisolo zoology Essomabirwadde bya bimera Phytopathology Essomabu

 a ray of light is derived from the Luganda verb okugenda to move to go to stream out Other technical terms created from this concept are Omugendo gwekitangaala light ray Omugendo gwamasannyalaze current Omugendo gwamasoboza movement of energy Ekigendo =ekibalo kyomugendo vector The synonym of omugendo movement is okuva Motion Okuva refers to any kind of motion whether it is a continuous motion in a straight line or not even mere vibration of atoms in the chair I am seated on is okuva but not om

ent Ganda also formed and named clans and totems after a variety of wild animals and plants that nature provided Each Muganda had to belong to one of the clans named after a particular animal or plant which he was forbidden from eating as a way of reducing depletion of wild life and nature There are actually clans and totems among the Baganda aimed at not only identifying blood relatives but also preserving nature Each clan seat ekiggwa should have schools and vocational institutions and farm in

crocodile spirit iv We also had clans named after the abundant provision of nature plants and wild life and if one belonged to a particular clan he or she would not eat that animal or plant This helped to prevent depletion of species So nature was protected from human abuse in that way With the coming of monolithic Abrahamic religions like Christianity people stopped fearing the world of punisher spirits resulting in encroachment and misuse of the forests and hills that had for generations been

enon or natutural phenomenakalonda wobutonde In plural natural phenomena is still collectively referred to as kalonda wobutonde The question on nature is followed by making a hypothesis which can be referred to as ekisinziiroekyo kwosinziira in scientific Luganda Ekisinziiro is simply statement trying to answer a scientific question Next is the act of validating okukakasa ekiteeberezo by trial and testing Testing is what we call engezeso in a process known as experimentation or okunoonya enkakas

part from obutonniinya subatomic particles named above there are building blocks of the subatomic particles konta and nampawengwa These are refered to as obutinniinya obutini ennyo elementary particles of the atom Note the difference between obutonniinya subatomic particles and obutinniinya elementary particles Note that in essomabiramu biology we also have obutaffaali not obutoffaali of chemistry for life cells as well as obuzaaluo or enzaaluzo genes and obusirigiinya chromosomes Then by blendi

 Gakuweebwa Muwanga Math Concepts formed by Clipping Very significant Luganda math words formed by clipping are the concepts of a nigi and Nigina the Luganda word for a unit of measurement It can also refer to ensusuuba units in place values The math word Namunigina formed by semantic extension is now the Luganda word for unit By Clipping we derive iv Nigina zamawanga ezebipimo international units of measurements This means that we can also talk of Obuwango ObusookesoPrefixes Gakuweebwa Charles

alled kyesatuza Why Kyesatuza etymologically comes from the Luganda numeral satu three It means multiplying a number by itself three times If the number is multiplied by itself three times the resulting product ekitondeko is called kyesatuza Watch this x x = Eight is therefore a cube number which is ennamba ya kyesatuza in Luganda The mathematical shape enkula eyekibalo formed looks like the cube above which is kyesatuza Kyebiriga square Gakuweebwa Charles Muwanga Gakuweebwa Charles Muwanga Okwe

led ekinonoozo which is engineering The specialist who applies the laws of science to build systems or machines is called omunonooza an engineer Unlike ekigereeso kya sayansi ennono ya sayansi is confirmed beyond reasonable doubt that it is valid in all situation and everywhere Therefore ennono za Sayansi ezOkuva or we can say amateeka ga sayansi agokuva have been tested and confirmed beyond reasonable doubt that they are the basis of motion in all circumstances and everywhere The necessary conc

+bbomu →Bbomu yObuziizi nuclear bomb v Verbverb compound okugenda + okugaana =okugendaggana parallelism Luganda scientific concepts formed by Clipping Okusalira ebigambo In word cutting using clipping a new concept is formed from an existing concept without changing its meaning Here the new word retains the meaning of the original concept A very good example of a concept formed by word cutting is entabaganya or entababantu society from entabaganyabantu human society or ekibalofrom ekibalangulo m

The Ssekabaka Kintu was King of Buganda and a Political philosopher at the same time He is credited for having founded the two tier Ganda administrative system the clan and political hierarchical system of administration Sekalowooleza Muwanga He is an ancient a Ganda Political Philosopher He is an ancient Buganda military strategist Ssekalowooleza Mukasa He was a researcher on aquatic lifer and the movement of winds on Lake Victoria Mukasas research made sailing on Lake Nalubaale safer as he had

ical bond the sperms are now baptized empakiso derived from the Luganda verb okuwakisa to make pregnant or okuwaka to impregnate which is in every way distinct from enkwaso chemical bonding In Luganda semen the watery stuff in which the sperms swim is now called empugiso Empugiso Luganda for semen is derived from the Luganda verb okuwuga which means to swim Empugiso etymologically means that which enables something in this case the sperms to swim to its target The name Muwanga in this case has s

egyenjawulo Waliwo  Omugendo gwekitangaala a ray of light  Omugendo gwamasoboza movement of energy  Omugendo gwempalirizo yamasanyalaze ne maggineeti movement of electromagnetic force  Omugendo gwaempalirizo ya erakitomagineeti movement of electromagnetic force  Omugendo gwamasannyalaze movement of electricity current  Omugendo gwobusannyalazothe flow of electrons Jjukira nti amasannyalaze gannyonnyolwa nga omugendo gwobusannyalazoflow or movement of electrons Buli mugendo guba nobutandiki

e concept of motion b Vatomu va + atomu means ion an atom which is in a state of motion or movement of electrons either by loss of electrons or gaining of electrons c Vatone vatomu +negatiiivu means anion This happens in a situation where there has been gaining of electron leading to a negative atom d Vatopo vatomu + pozitiivu means cat ion This happens in a situation where there has been loss of electrons leading to a positive atom e Vampawengwa va+ nampawengwa or vampais the Luganda concept fo

s In compounding two or more bits of words combine into a single concept Compound words may be open joined by a hyphen or closed This is actually a marriage of words which results into formation of one word out of two or more without altering their spellings There are two scenarios in the meanings of the new word formed In the first scenario the meaning is determined by combining the meanings of the parts as in endagabwolekero compass or compass rose The second scenario is when the meaning of th

 no heirs to carry on the clan heritage It is a curious fact that the clans are not known by the names of the respective clan founders Instead totems were adopted by the clans and the names of those totems came to be synonymous with the clans themselves Each clan has a main totem omuziro and a secondary totem akabbiro The clans are usually known by the main totem and they are listed above by that totem The royal clan Abalangira is a unique exception in that it has no totems whatsoever For a prop

y research work for free public consumption Ekinnalinnya epynom simply means ekigambo ekibbuddwa mu linnya lyomuntu a word formed from the name of a real or fictitious person The Luganda concept for rainbow Kkala za Musoke is an eponym and so are the days of the week in Luganda We can talk of Endaga ya Kkala za Musoke or Ekkamuso rainbow colours named from an ancient Buganda researcher on the phenomenon called rainbow The English names of the planets enkulungo in our solar system are all eponyms

lligence Generally the various concepts associaated with the word amagezi wisdom are a Obwakalimagezi intelligence Obwakalimagezi is a compound word whose root is amagezi wisdom This root is combined with a prefix obwapractice of to produce the concept of obwakalimageziintelligence b Omuntukalimagezi intelligent man c Komasapiyensa Homo sapiens It is a loanword borrowed from the english homo sapiens wise man Komasapiyensa can also be translated Omuntu kalimagezi d Ensolo kalimagezi intelligent a

hat is the mathematics and science behind the motion or movement of a helicopter as a system  Ekitambuzo kyennyonyi eyamasukuma ag omukka the mechanics of a jet plane meaning ekibalo ekitambuza ennyonyi esukumwa omukka ngensengekera that is the mathematics and science behind the motion or movement of a jet plane as a system Ekitambuzo lyettabi lyessomabutonde erisoma okuva motion Omwana yenna arina okusikirizibwa okwagala essomo lino eryekitambuzo okuva nga muto kubanga okuva mulamwa mukulu mu

rotozoa olufungi fungus among others An intellectualized language must have concepts to explain that the building blocks of matter which are called obutoffalikazimbakintu not obutaffaalikazimbakintu are the atoms which are called atomu in Luganda The atomu also has its building blocks obutoffaalikazimbatomu that are called subatomic particles which we call obutonniinya obutono ennyo These include obusannyalazo electrons obukontanyo or konta or obukonta protons and nampawengwa or nampa neutrons A

tion The indispensables of an intellectual Language For Luganda language the first category of musthave words of an intellectual language are The prefix entaba denotes interaction of people Note that entabamuriro combustion denotes interactive action between air and fuel to power a vehicle or a machine One necessary concept for an upcoming language of science is the concept of system to help the natives develop the idea of an organized whole made up of parts that are interrelated This is very im

za nebikolebwa ku malimiro education on farm activities That is the etymological meaning of ebyamalimiroEddimiro is Luganda for a farm In plural it becomes amalimiro farms Mu ebyamalimiro mulimu Ebyobulimi crop farming Ebyobulunzi animal farming Ebyebibira forestry farming Ebyebimuli floriculture c Ebyobunyukufu Literature This is from the phrase ebyenjigiriza nebikolebwa ebyobunyukufu education and activities in the field of Literacy Obunyukufu is Luganda for literacy Ebyobunyukufu is literatur

na + okugaana okusisinkana is formed by blending the mathematical concept of okugendaggana ne meaning to be parallel to Layini is a loan word meaning line which is also translated as olukoloboze or omusittale So Layini ezigendaggana denotes Parallel Lines For instance in reproductive biology in Luganda Luganda been using the word enkwaso to refer to the bonding staff of life called sperms which is also used to mean chemical bond in chemistry but to clearly separate the concepts of sperm and chem

ekkuumiro lyebisolo erya Rwenzori Mountains okuva mu okutuuka Ssebaaseka Ekkuumiro lyateekebwa ku byobulambuzi ebyali mu katyaba wakati wa ne olwobutaali butebenkevu nebbula lyebikozesebwa mu kkuumiro because of insecurity and a lack of resources in the park Ekkuumiro lyebisolo erya Rwenzori Mountains National Park lisangibwa mu bukiikakkono bwobugwanjuba bwa Uganda mu bugwanjuba bwobuvanjuba bwa African Rifty Valley Esangibwa ku nsalo ya Uganda ne Democratic Republic of Congo DRC era esalagana

root omulandira gwa kyebiriga is obviously If ennamba ya kyebiriga is its omulandira gwa kyebiriga square root is and if you have ennamba ya kyebiriga its omulandira gwa kyebiriga is Omulandira gwa Kyesatuza Cube root Omulandira gwa kyesatuza is also referred to as omulandira ogwokusatu ogwennamba the third root of a number Ennamba za kyesatuza emirandira gyazo egya kyesatuza giba Kubanga singa wekubisaamu buli gumu emirundi esatu gwa ennamba za kyesatuza Enkula eva mu ekyo eba kyebirigaSquare s

obuzitoya moleculesManya mole = mass cule= tiny or very small So molecule means very small massenzitoya entono ennyo In Luganda molecule is akazitoya and in plural it is obuzitoyamolecules Obuziba bwa okisigyeni bubiri bukolq qkazitoya ka okisigyenioxigen molecule kamu ate obuziba bwa ayidologyeni bubiri nakaziba ka akisigyeni kamu bukola akazitoya kamazziwater molecule kamu Obuzitoya nga bwesigalizza embeera yabwo eyobutonde bwe bukola embeera essatu buli kintu mwe kisangibwa Omukka kyekyo ekiz

f If a teacher knows how a concept was formed he or she will be in a better position to help the learners grasp its mathematical or scientific meaning Word analysis is done by breaking a blended word into its etymological constituent bits of words of pharses that were blended or compounded to form it For example i Ekisengeko Matrix can be broken down into a Eki for ekibalo kya means the mathematics of b sengeko is Emisengeko Patterns in full So ekisengekoMatrix is blended out of the phrase ekiba

 concept for energy amasoboza by blending Follow the following procedure a Get the foreign language concept energy and give it its simple English definition b Write out the simple English definition in vernacular Luganda for this matter The definition should be in form of a short sentence or phrase Then look for the parts to cut out or clip to get the desired shortened concept It is finished In simple English energy is the ability to do work c This is translated as obusobozi okukola omulimu whic

 discount is derived from the wordokukendeeza to reduce It can also be referred to as ekikendeezo ekitundu ekikendeezeddwa ku mutemwa xv The mathematical concept omujjuulirizo or enzijuulirizo top up subsidy is a derivation from okujjuuliriza to top up xvi The concepts of omugereeso math theory eggereeso theorem and ekigereeso scientific theory are derivations from the word okugereesa to theorise to make a guess From this we derive the concepts of Omugereeso gwa namba number theory Eggereeso lya

mical elements and their abbreviations or symbols are almost all borrowed from the one of English For ease of uniformity all the vernacular abbreviations should remain as they are in English in all our blafrican languages Luganda scientific concepts formed by semantic extension Okugaziya amakulu Semantic extension In terminology you can form a new concept by broadening the meaning of an existing word or phrase in your vernacular which word is close in meaning to the foreign concept you intend to

 practices which the majority of our youths of today are not aware of Most of the Blafican youths in contemporary Africa are neither dependent on superstitions nor scientific knowledge in their search for a living in agriculture and forestry Forests are cut down with impunity for firewood charcoal burning and timber and wetlands hills and water bodies are not spared misuse in the search for the shortterm economic survival This is what is driving me to open discourse on science centered culture o

attika eponyms ebinnalinnya and derivation obuwango are usually from the internal sources of a vernacular A good example of a blended English concept is the English word motel from the words motor hotel The letters or were clipped from the first word motor and the letters ho were clipped from the second word hotel living mot and el from both words When the Skeletons of the two are joined we get the new concept motel This is concept formation by blending Let me show you how we came to the Luganda

er understanding of the culture however it is important to distinguish between the totem and the clan The clan is a matter of genealogy and it is through the clan that the baganda trace their ancestry A totem on the other hand is just a symbol to represent the clan Although the two are intimately associated with one another they are in fact different In the west a totem would be similar to a court of arms The table below gives the list of the clans of Buganda A hot link on a specific clan indica

owing understanding and discovery among others f Nnyoloni neuron This is a loanword from the english word neurons Nnyoloni neurons are simply the building blocks of the brain The Luganda word nnyoloni is pronounced starting with nnyosound and not nyusound which sounds like new The neurons are determenants of human intelligence and the functioning of omulengera the human mind The synonym for nnyolonineuron is Obutaffaalikazimbabwongothe building blocks of the brain which is a compoud word made of

o had its wise men that dealt with various challenges that faced their respective clans The deceased wise men at clan levels are venerated as Lubaale wekika One ancient clan Wiseman was Kisolo Ssebyato Muwanga c National Wise Men These were great thinkers from among the geniuses selected from the clans and put in the service of the Kabaka One ancient clan wiseman was Muwanga the national thinker who came from Ssese Island in Kalangala District This wise man is said to have been of the Ngonge Ott

 to round off is a derivation from the Luganda word okuzinga to fold Omukunuukirizo is from the phrase omuwendo omukunuukirize Omutonnyeze The mathematical concept of omutonnyeze decimal number is a derivation from the Luganda noun akatonnyeze point When you add the prefix omu you get omutonnyeze decimal value decimal number Omutonnyeze is from the phrase omuwendo ogwakatonnyewze xii Ekiwords The prefix eki denotes ekibalo kya The mathematics of Or ekikube kya the drawing of or ekigambululo ekif

ons Essomankula Geometry the study of mathematical shapes Essomampuyissatu Essomampetossatu Trigonometry SessomaDisciplines Essomadenotes study of science of It is the equivalent of the English logy words Charles Muwanga has been able to build Luganda concepts for most academic disciplines and subdisciplines using essoma prefix which also has the same function as Eby prefix Examples of academic Luganda disciplines formed using essomaprefix include Essomampimo or Ebyempimo Geometry Study of Geome

eto eggolokofu a Eppeto angle Epeto is the Luganda word for an angle Its synonyms are ensonda which is the Luganda word for the English corner ekkoona a borrowed word from English corner In my view use of the math words epeto and ensonda in math discourse dependes on the context The mathword epeto or amaweto in plural which comes from the Luganda verb okuweta to bend is more flexible when it comes to formation of clusters of words with interconnected meanings From the mathword epeto angle we are

ovement of electrons either by loss of electrons or gaining of electrons c Vatone vatomu +negatiiivu means anion This happens in a situation where there has been gaining of electron leading to a negative atom d Vatopo vatomu + pozitiivu means cat ion This happens in a situation where there has been loss of electrons leading to a positive atom e Vampawengwa va + nampawengwa or vampais the Luganda concept for isotope Vampawengwa Vampa is formed when some atoms of the same element lose neutrons nam

he Enkuluze yOluganda eyEnnono Lugnda Cultural Dictionary ekibalangulo is an archaic Luganda word associated with sharpeningmetallic weapons So the etymological meaning of ekibalangulo is rooted in the act of sharpening Today the mathematics is considered to be the subject that sharpens the mind In fact a student who performs well in mathematics finds other disciplines of study easy because his mind is sharpened Ekibalangulo mathematics in short form is ekibalo or okubala for math The good thing

acturing Okutondeka can also refer to creation of mental or abstract ideas Okutondeka thus refers to both the verb to produce to manufacture and the noun production or the process of manufacturing It ordinarily means production or manufacturing of goods and commodities made from the natural resources created by God for use by man The concept of okutondeka is formed by blending the words okutonda + ebikoleka omuntu The noun derived from the act of okutondeka entondeka way or techniques of manufac

 them by instructing his chiefs to build ebiggwa shrines for each of them The Kabaka even offered his fallen philosophers and artisans sacrifices because like his subjects he believed that when they died their spirits would remain ingenious as they had been when they were alive These ingenious men were especially utilized during times of national crisis during which the Kabaka would turn to them to answer challenging situations in his rule Kabaka Nakibinge utilized them in his wars with Bunyoro

 The above derivations are blends or compound words xiii The mathematical concept of omuganyulo or omuganyulwo interest is a derivation from the verb okuganyula to benefit to be useful to Other terms derived from this concept include Omuganyulo omwangu simple interest Omuganyulo omuzibuwavu compound interest Okubaza omuganyulo calculating interest Omuganyulo gwa banka bank interest Omuganyulo gwekyewolo loan interest xiv The mathematical concept omukendeezo discount is derived from the word okuk

d ennambuluzo factors of a number are derivations from the Luganda word okulambulula to explain in detail From the concept of okulambulula namba the following mathematical concepts are derived Namba ennambulukufu composite numbers Namba ezerambulula composite numbers Namba ezitali nambulukufu prime number Namba eziterambulula prime numbers iv The mathematical concept of okugendaggana to be parallel parallelism is derived from blending the two Luganda wordsokugendana to match to be equal in stren

eory There are two words crucial for grasping the basic concepts in number theory i The symbols are called numerals eg ii The names of the numerals are the numbers like zero one two three We have borrowed the two concepts that is adopted and adapted them to Luganda phnology and orthography as ennamba the name for number and ennambiso the symbol for numeral The Luganda word omuwendo refers to the value in a number or ennambiso or a digit Users should be careful because omuwendo in most cases refe

 by God and okutondeka the act of producing manufacturing or to creation by man The word to create is used more for the creative act of God and less for the creative act of man I have separated the two concepts by coming up with the Luganda concept of okutondeka to produce production to manufacture manufacturing to create to refer to the creative act of man Okutondeka is a blend word from okutonda ebikolekaomuntu creation by man from the resources provided by God referring to production or manuf

tomic level among atoms to cause a chemical change is what is called okutomeggana to react chemically vii The concept of enkyukakyuka ezebuziba chemical change is a compound word from the Luganda word ebuzibaorobuziba the innermost part the farthest part the core When compounded with the word enkyukakyuka change we get a new concept in chemistry enkyukakyuka ezebuziba chemical change The opposite is enkyukakyuka ezo kungulu physical change viii The concept of omugendo movement in a straight line

 to explore the science behind light These are the words you need to explain the science behind light in Luganda  Ekitangaala Light  Obutunniinya bwekitangaala Particles of light  Obupaketi bwekitangaala Packets of light  Obutonniinya oba obutoffaali bwakazibaatomu Subatomic particles  Obutinniinya The building blocks of the atom  Ebyebulungulo byomugendo gwamasanyalaze ne Magineeti Electromagnetic fields  Ebbugumu Heat  Olubugumuoluyengo lyebbugumu Radiation  Omugendo A Ray of energy 

somawhich is Luganda for logy meaning essomo lya the study of or the science of The list of academic disciplines we now have in Luganda thanks to Muwangas innovative terminology research is long Other disciplines and subdisciplines formed using essoma prefix are Essomabikuyege Acarology Essomalubugumu Actinibilology Essomakitangamiko Actinology Essomabupempewo Aerobiology Essomannampewo Aerology Essomabulimiro Agrology Essomattakalikuza Agrobiology Essomansibukoyandwadde Aetiology Essomamiddo Ag

 existing Luganda words yet omumeeme must have been derived from Umeme Swahili for electricity Omugendo refers to any movement even if it is movement of fluids A more appropriate word would be omugendo movement of anything whether it is a fluid or not which by semantic extension gives us omugendo gwamasannyalaze electric current I have also read of obugububi obumeeme in contrast to ekigugubiro kyamasannyalaze for electric resistance Which of the two is more obvious more understandable in transla

the area of manufacturing okutondeka ii Ekidda This prefix denotes forward or backward movement Examples Ekiddannyuma negative reverse Ekiddamaaso positive forward movement Examples Ennamba za kiddannyuma negative numbers or ennamba za kiddamaasopositive numbers But we can also borrow and adopt these mathematics concepts directly from English as follows Ennamba za negatiivu negative numbers or ennamba za pozitiivu positive numbers iii Enta This prefix means without For example  Entakyuka withou
nimal This is a concept of two seperated compound words ensolo animal and kalimagezi intelligent being a genius The synonyms are omuntu kalimagezi intelligent man or kalimagezi intelligent man or omuntu omugezi wise man e Omulengera the human mind This concept is formed by blending of the words omwoyo ogukulengeza the spirit that illuminates to getomulengerathe soul of foresight the spirit that foresees Omulengera the mind is a faculty of the brain that brings about critical thinking analysis kn
